title: the Abyssal Demon
intro: Originally a Templar from Everlight, the Bastion of the Valorians, Arcian was exiled when he destroyed one of the five noble houses, Skyforge and killed their Pillar. His Soulforge, Monochrome, grants him the ability to remove the colour of all matters, rendering all other abilities useless. This ability can be molded into any shape, which he often uses for his cloak, wolf and all the blades that he carries. Each blade is crafted from a formidable opponent that he has faced, and the most dangerous one is the rumoured crimson blade which also carries the millions of souls whom entrusted their faith in him.

abilities.name: Monochrome Blade
abilities.details:
Arcian's basic attacks generates a stack of Monochrome Blade, stacking up to three times.

The third stack empowers his basic attack to deal bonus magical damage (scaling with physical power and magical power), and steals a small amount of the target's mana.

abilities.name: Phantom Slash
abilities.details: Arcian slashes twice at a target, each dealing physical damage (scaling with physical power). Each hit is counted as a basic attack.

abilities.name: Spectral Arsenal
abilities.details:
Arcian periodically crafts a Spectral Blade, up to a maximum of three can be stored at a time. Each Spectral Blade grants him bonus physical power (scaling with physical power).

Arcian can cast this ability to manifest one Spectral Blade at the target location.

abilities.name: Void Steps
abilities.details: Arcian shifts to a manifested Spectral Blade on the ground, then empowers his next basic attack to blink to the enemy target, dealing bonus physical damage (scaling with physical power)

abilities.name: Oblivion's Decree
abilities.details:
Arcian enters a heightened state for several seconds, gaining bonus movement speed and attack speed.

During this state, Arcian replaces his Monochrome Blade with the Oblivion Blade, making his third basic attack deals true damage instead of magical damage, and briefly silences the target instead of stealing mana.

The same enemy hero cannot be silenced twice during each Oblivion's Decree, and will become vulnerable to mana steal again after the first silence.
